snippet: The overall debts of the federal government are five times as large as the much discussed "national debt," and can be addressed only through a very long-term approach, an economist writes.
abstract: The overall debts of the federal government are five times as large as the much discussed "national debt," and can be addressed only through a very long-term approach, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the coming book "The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform - Why We Need It and What It Will Take."
